text: ...surgical chamber. And watching the screens is a...
...chimp, strapped to an operating table, with its skull dissected open, webbed in wires and monitoring devices, muzzled with a transparent guard. Alive.
Behind the surgical chamber, through the wide doorframe, can see a larger laboratory beyond.
A group of black-clad ALF Activists, all wearing balaclav move down a corridor. They carry various gear - bag, bolt cutters.
As they move, one Activist reaches up to a security camer and sprays it black with an aerosol paint can.
The Activists enter the laboratory.
Fucking hell...
The Chief Activist takes his camera off his shoulder and starts taking photos.

The room is huge and long, and darkened except for specif pools of light. Partially illuminated are rows of cages w clear perspex doors. They run down either side of the roo In the cages are chimpanzees. 2.
Most are in a state of rabid agitation, banging and clawi against the perspex, baring teeth through foam-flecked mouths.
They reach the far end of the lab, where on a huge steel operating table they see the dissected chimp.
Oh God...
The dissected chimp's eyes flick to the Activists. Blood wells from around the exposed brain tissue.
Tears starts to roll down the Female Activist's cheeks.
(to Female Activist) Keep your shit together. If we're going to get them out of here...
The Finnish Activist is checking the perspex cages.
I can pop these, no problem.
So get to it.
The Finnish Activist raises his crowbar and sticks it aro the edge of one of the doors - about to prise it open.
At the moment, the doors to the laboratory bang open.
The Activists all turn. Standing at the entrance is the Scientist.
A pause. The Scientist jumps to a telephone handset on th wall and shouts into the receiver.
Security! We have a break-in! Get to sector...
A hand slams down the disconnect button.
...nine.
The Chief Activist plucks the receiver from the Scientist hands, and then rips the telephone from the wall.
A beat. 3.
I know who you are, I know what you think you're doing, but you have to listen to me. You can't release these animals.
If you don't want to get hurt, shut your mouth, and don't move a fucking muscle.
The chimps are infected!
The Activists hesitate, exchanging a glance.
(continuing; stumbling,
These animals are highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.
Infected with what?
Chemically restricted, locked down to a... a single impulse that...
Infected with what?
The Scientist hesitates before answering.
Rage.
Behind the Activists, the bank of monitors show the faces the machete-wielding crowd.
(desperately trying to
In order to cure, you must first understand. Just imagine: to have power over all the things we feel we can't control. Anger, violence...
What the fuck is he talking about? 4.
We don't have time for this shit! Get the cages open!
No!
We're going, you sick bastard, and we're taking your torture victims with us.
NO! You must listen! The animals are contagious! The infection is in their blood and saliva! One bite and...
They won't bite me.
The Female Activist crouches down to face the wild eyes o the infected chimp behind the perspex.
STOP! You have no idea!
The Scientist makes a desperate lunge towards her, but th Chief Activist grabs him.
Good boy. You don't want to bite me, do you?
The Female Activist gives a final benign smile, then the Finnish Activist pops open the door.
Like a bullet from a gun, the infected chimp leaps out at Female Activist - and sinks its teeth into her neck. She reels back as the chimp claws and bites with extraordinar viciousness.
At the same moment, a deafening alarm begins to sound.
Get it off! Get if off!
The Finnish Activist rips the ape off and throws it on to floor. The infected chimp immediately bites into the man' leg. He yells with pain, and tries to kick it off. 5.
Behind him, the Female Activist has started to scream. Sh doubles up, clutching the side of her head.
I'm burning! Jesus! Help me!
We have to kill her!
I'm burning! I'm burning!
What's...
We have to kill her NOW!

Meanwhile, the Female Activist's cries have become an unwavering howl of pain - and she is joined by the Finnis Activist, whose hands have also flown to the side of his head, gripping his temples as if trying to keep his skull from exploding.
What's wrong with them?
The Scientist grabs a desk-lamp base and starts running towards the screaming Female Activist...
...who has ripped off her balaclava - revealing her face the face of an Infected.
She turns to the Scientist.
Oh God.
She leaps at him. He screams as they go tumbling to the ground.
The Chief Activist watches in immobile horror as she atta the Scientist with amazing ferocity.
Another ACTIVIST makes his way down the corridor towards lab.
Terry? Jemma? 6.
No answer.
Mika? Where are you?
He reaches the door to the lab, which is closed - and...
...as he opens it, we realize the door is also soundproof
A wall of screaming hits him.
He stands in the doorway - stunned by the noise, and then sight.
Blood, death, and his colleagues, all Infected.
Bloody hell.
The Infected rush him.
Close up of Jim, a young man in his twenties, wearing pal green hospital pyjamas. He has a month's beard, is dishevelled, and asleep.
We pull back to see that Jim is lying on a hospital bed, private room. Connected to his arms are multiple drips, a full row of four or five on each side of his bed. Most of bags are empty.
Jim's eyes open.
He looks around with an expression of confusion. Then he up. He is weak, but he swings his legs off the bed and stands. The attached drips are pulled with him and clatte the floor.
Jim winces, and pulls the taped needles from his arm.
Ow...
His voice is hoarse, his mouth dry. Massaging his throat, walks to the door. 7.
The door to Jim's hospital room is locked. The key is on floor. He picks it up and opens the door.
Jim exits into a corridor.
At the far end, a sign read: COMA WARD. There is no sign life or movement.
Jim walks down the corridor. One of the doors is half-ope From inside, there is the sound of buzzing flies.
Jim moves as quickly as he can through the hospital, stil weak, but now driven by adrenaline.

All the wards and corridors are deserted. Medical notes a equipment lie strewn over the floors, trolleys are upende glass partition doors are smashed. In a couple of places, splashes of dried blood arc up the walls.
He reaches A&E. On one wall is a row of public pay ph
He lifts a receiver, and the line is dead. He goes down t line, trying them all.
In the corner of the A&E reception is a smashed soft- machine, with a few cans collected at the base.
Jim grabs one, rips off the ring-pull and downs it in one Then he grabs another, and heads for the main doors.
Jim exits and walks out into the bright daylight of the forecourt. The camera begins to pull away from him.
Hello?
Aside from a quiet rush of wind, there is silence. No traffic, no engines, no movement. Not even birdsong.
Jim walks through the empty city, from St. Thomas's Hospi over Westminster Bridge, past the Houses of Parliament, d Whitehall, to Trafalgar Square. 8.
A bright overhead sun bleaches the streets. A light drift litter and refuse. Cars lie abandoned, shops looted.
Jim is still wearing his hospital pyjamas, and carries a plastic bag full of soft-drink cans.
Jim walks. Night has fallen. He needs to find a place to rest...
He pauses. Down a narrow side street is a church. He walk towards it. The front doors are open.
Jim walks inside, moving with the respectful quietness th people adopt when entering a church.
The doors ahead to the main chamber are closed. Pushing t gently trying the handle, it is obvious they are locked. another open door is to his left. He goes through it.
Jim moves up a stairwell.
Written large on the wall is a single line of graffiti:

head_text.subj: REPENT. THE END IS EXTREMELY FUCKING NIGH

text: Jim moves into the gallery level, and sees, through the d and rot, ornate but faded splendor. At the far end, a sta glass window is illuminated by the moonlight.
Jim pads in, stands at the gallery, facing the stained-gl window for a moment before looking down...
Beneath are hundreds of dead bodies. Layered over the flo jammed into the pews, spilling over the altar. The scene an unimaginable massacre.
Jim stands, stunned. Then sees, standing motionless at different positions facing away from him, four people.
Their postures and stillness make their status unclear. J hesitates before speaking. 9.
...Hello?
Immediately, the four heads flick around. Infected.
And the next moment, there is the powerful thump of a doo the far end of the gallery.
Jim whirls to the source as the Infected below start to m
The door thumps again - another stunningly powerful blow, noise echoing around the chamber.
Confused, fist closing around his bag of soft drinks, Jim steps onto the gallery, facing the door...
...and it smashes open.
Revealing an Infected Priest - who locks sight on Jim, an starts to sprint.
Father?
The Priest is half way across the gallery
Father, what are you...

And now the moonlight catches the Priest's face. Showing clearly: the eyes. The blood smeared and collected around nose, ears, and mouth. Darkened and crusted, accumulated days and weeks. Fresh blood glistening.
Jesus!
In a movement of pure instinct, Jim swings the bag just a the Priest is about to reach him - and connects squarely the man's head.
Oh, that, was bad, that was bad... I shouldn't have done that...
He breaks into a run...
Down the stairwell... 10.
...into the front entrance, where the locked door now str under the blows of the Infected inside.
Shit.
Jim sprints down the stone steps.
As he reaches the bottom the doors are broken open, and t Infected give chase.
Jim runs - the Infected have almost reached him.
A hand fires up a Zippo lighter, and lights the rag of a Molotov cocktail.
As Jim runs, something flies past his head, and the Infec closest to him explodes in a ball of flame.
Jim turns, and sees as another Molotov cocktail explodes, engulfing two in the fireball.
He whirls, now completely bewildered.
Another Molotov cocktail explodes. The Infected stagger f the blaze, on fire.
Jim whirls again, and sees, further down the road...
...Selena, a black woman, also in her twenties. She wears small backpack, a machete is stuck into her belt - and sh holds a lit Molotov cocktail in her hand.
...Mark, a tall, good-looking man - throwing another bott
It smashes on the head of the last Infected, bathing it i flame...
The burning Infected bumps blindly into a car. Falls. Get again. 11.
Blindly, it staggers off the road, into a petrol station where an abandoned car has run over on the pumps.
The ground beneath it suddenly ignites, and the petrol station explodes.
Selena and Mark lead Jim into a side street.
Those people! Who were... who...
This way! Move it!
Jim allows himself to be hurried along.

Selena stops outside a newsagent's shop. The shop's door windows are covered with a metal security grill, but the grill over the door lock has been prised away enough for Selena to slip her hand through to the latch.
Inside, most of the shelves have been emptied of confectionery. Newspapers and magazines litter the floor. magazine covers of beautiful girls and sports cars have become instant anachronisms.
At the back of the shop, a makeshift bed of sheets and sleeping bag is nestled. This has obviously been Selena a Mark's home for the last few days.
Jim, Mark and Selena enter the newsagent's and pull down grill.

A man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. The giraffe falls over. The man goes to leave and the barman says, you can't leave that lying there. The man says, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe. 12.
Silence.
Mark pulls off his mask and turns to Selena.
He's completely humorless. You two will get along like a house on fire.
Selena, who has already taken off her mask, ignores Mark.
Who are you? You've come from a hospital.
Are you a doctor?
He's not a doctor. He's a patient.
I'm a bicycle courier. I was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue. A car cut across me... and then I wake up in hospital, today... I wake up and I'm hallucinating, or...
What's your name?
Jim.
I'm Mark. This is Selena.
Okay, Jim. We've got some bad news.
Selena starts to tell her story, and as the story unfolds see the images she describes.

It began as rioting. And right from the beginning, you knew something bad was going on because the rioters were killing people. And then it wasn't on the TV anymore. It was in the street outside. It was coming through your windows. We all guessed it was a virus. An infection. You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. It was the blood. 13.

Something in the blood. By the time they tried to evacuate the cities, it was already too late. The infection was everywhere. The army blockades were overrun. And that was when the exodus started. The day before the radio and TV stopped broadcasting there were reports of infection in Paris and New York. We didn't hear anything more after that.
Where are your families?
They're dead.
Yours will be dead too.
No... No! I'm going to find them. They live in Greenwich. I can walk. (heading for the exit) I'm going to... to go and...
You'll go and come back.
(pulling at the grill) Yes! I'll go and come back.

Rules of survival. Lesson one - you never go anywhere alone, unless you've got no choice. Lesson two - you only move during daylight, unless you've got no choice. We'll take you tomorrow. Then we'll all go and find your dead parents. Okay?
Jim, Selena and Mark walk along the Docklands Light Railw in single file. Ahead is a train.
Behind the train, as if spilled in its wake, are abandone bags, suitcases, backpacks.
Mark drops pace to let Jim catch up. 14.
How's your head? Fucked?
No reply.

(gesturing at the city) I know where your head is. You're looking at these windows, these millions of windows, and you're thinking - there's no way this many people are dead. It's just too many windows.
Mark picks up a handbag from the tracks.
The person who owned this bag. Can't be dead.
Mark reaches in and starts to pull things out as they wal discarding the personal possessions.
A woman - (car keys) - who drove a Nissan Micra - (teddy) - and had a little teddy bear - (condoms) - and carried protection, just in case.
Marks tosses the condoms behind him.
Believe me, we won't need them anymore than she will.
He hands the bag to Jim and walks ahead.
Jim pulls out a mobile phone.
He switches it on.
It reads: SEARCHING FOR NETWORK.
The message blinks a couple of times. Then the screen goe blank.
Jim looks left.
He is now alongside the train. The inside of the windows smeared with dried blood. Pressed against the glass is th face of a dead man. 15.
Jim drops the phone and breaks into a run - running past and Selena.
Hey!
Jim, Selena and Mark jog across Greenwich Common. Jim gestures towards one of the streets on the far side of th green.
Down there. Westlink Street. Second on the left.
The street is modest red-brick semi-detached houses. They stand outside Number 43. Jim waits while Selena scans the dark facade.
If there's anyone in there who isn't human...
I understand.
Anyone.
I understand.
Selena shoots a glance at Jim. Jim is gazing at the house
Okay.
Jim uses the key under the flowerpot to open the back doo
Jim, Selena and Mark move quietly through the kitchen and downstairs of the house. 16.
Surprisingly, everything is neat and tidy. Washed plates stacked by the sink, newspapers on the table are neatly piled. The headline on the top paper reads simply: CONTAINMENT FAILS.
They reach the bottom of the stairs. Selena gestures upwa and Jim nods. They start to ascend.
At the top of the stairs, Selena sniffs the air, and reco Jim has noticed it too. His eyes widen in alarm.
Wait.
But Jim pushes past and advances along the top landing, u he reaches a door. By now the smell is so bad that he is having to cover his nose and mouth with the sleeve of one arm.
Jim pushes open the door. Inside, two decomposed bodies l side by side on the bed, intertwined. On the bedside tabl are an empty bottle of sleeping pills and a bottle of red wine.
Mark appears behind him. Jim stares at his parents for a couple of moments, then Mark closes the door.
Jim sits on the toilet, alone. He is crying. In his hand piece of paper: "Jim - with endless love, we left you sleeping. Now we're sleeping with you. Don't wake up."
The paper crumples in his fist.
Jim, Selena and Mark sit in the living room, on the two sofas. Jim looks dazed, uncomprehending. Selena watches J her expression neutral.
They died peacefully. You should be grateful.
I'm not grateful.
Jim's words hang a moment. Then Mark talks, simply, unemotionally, matter-of-fact throughout. 17.

The roads out were all jammed. So we went to Paddington Station. Hoping: maybe we could get to Heathrow, maybe buy our way on a plane. My dad had all this cash, even though cash was already useless, and Mum had her jewellery. But twenty thousand other people had the same idea.

The crowd was surging, and I lost my grip on my sister's hand. I remember realizing the ground was soft. I looked down, and I was standing on people. Like a carpet, people who had fallen, and... somewhere in the crowd there were infected. It spread fast, no one could run, all you could do was climb. Over more people. So I did that. I got up, somehow, on top of a kiosk.

Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. With the blood, the screaming, they all looked the same. And I saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. But I saw my dad. His face.
A short silence.
Selena's right. You should be grateful.
We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight.
Jim nods. He isn't sure what he wants to say.
My old room was at the end of the landing. You two take it. I'll sleep down here.
We'll sleep in the same room. It's safer. 18.
The red orb of the sun goes down; the light fades. As nig falls, London vanishes into blackness, with no electric l to be seen.
Then the moon appears from behind the cloud layer, and th dark city is revealed.
Jim is on the sofa. In the moonlight, we can see that his eyes are open, wide awake. Selena is curled on the other sofa, and Mark is on the floor - both asleep. The house i silent.
Jim watches Selena sleeping for a couple of moments.
Then, quietly, he gets off the sofa and pads out of the living room, down the hall to the kitchen.

Jim enters, standing just inside the doorway. He looks ar the room. On one wall, a faded kid's drawing of a car is framed. Above the counter, on a shelf of cookery books, a album has a handwritten label on the spine: "Mum's Favori Recipes".
Jim walks to the fridge. Stuck to the door is a photo of with his parents, arm in arm, smiling at the camera. Jim on his mountain bike, wearing his courier bag.
Jim, sitting at the kitchen table as his Mum enters, carr bags of shopping. Jim walks over to the bags and pulls ou carton of orange juice, which he pulls straight to his mo and begins to gulp down.
His Dad walks in from the garden.
Give me a glass of that, would you?
(draining the carton, and giving it a shake) It's empty.
Jim touches the photo, their faces, lightly.
Jim is facing away from the back door, which has a large frosted-glass panel.
Through the glass panel, unseen by Jim a dark silhouette looms against the diffused glow from the moonlight.
Through the kitchen window, a second silhouette appears.
Then there is a scratching noise from the back door.
Jim freezes.
Slowly, he turns his head, and sees the dark shapes behin the door and window.
A beat - then the door is abruptly and powerfully smashed It flies open, and hangs loosely held by the bottom hinge Standing in the doorframe is an Infected Man.

Jim shouts with alarm as the Man lunges at him - and they both go tumbling to the floor. At the same moment, the fi behind the kitchen window smashes the glass, and an Infec Teenage Girl starts to clamber through the jagged frame.
The Man gets on top of Jim, while Jim uses his arms to ho back the ferocious assault. A single strand of saliva fli from the Man's lips, and contacts Jim's cheek.
Help!
Suddenly, Selena is there, holding her machete. The blade flashes down to the back of the Man's neck. Blood gushes.
Jim rolls the Infected Man off, just in time to see...
...Mark dispatch the Girl half way through the kitchen window. The Girl is holding Mark, but her legs are caught the broken glass.
Mark jabs upwards into the Girl's torso - she stiffens, t slumps, and as Mark steps back we see he is holding a kni
Jim hyperventilates, staring at the corpse on the kitchen floor.
It's Mr. Bridges...
Selena turns to Jim. She is hyperventilating too, but the is control and steel in her voice. 20.
Were you bitten?
He lives four doors down...
Jim turns to the Girl sprawled half way through the windo
That's his daughter...
Were you bitten?
Jim looks at her. Selena is still holding her machete at ready.
No... No! I wasn't!
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?
No!
Mark?
Jim turns to Mark. He is standing in the middle of the ro Stepped away from the window. The Girl's blood is on his and he is wiping it away...
...off the skin... where a long scratch cut wells up fres blood.
A moment.
Then Mark looks at Selena, as if slightly startled.
Wait.
But Selena is swiping with her machete. Mark lifts his ar instinctively, defensively, and the blade sinks in.
Selena immediately yanks it back.
Selena swipes again - and the blade catches Mark hard in side of the head. Mark falls. 21.
Jim watches, scrabbling backwards on the floor away from them, as Selena brutally finishes Mark off.
Selena looks at Mark's body for a couple of beats, then lowers the blade. She picks up a dishcloth from the sink counter and tosses it to Jim.
Get that cleaned off.
Jim picks up the rag and hurriedly starts to wipe the Infected's blood from around his neck.
Do you have any clothes here?
(fazed, frightened of her) I... I don't know. I think so.
Then get them. And get dressed. We have to leave, now.
With practiced speed, Selena starts to open the kitchen cupboards, selecting packets of biscuits and cans from th shelves, and stuffing them into her backpack.
More infected will be coming. They always do.
Jim and Selena exit the front door. Jim has changed out o his hospital gear into jeans and a sweatshirt. He also ha small backpack, and is carrying a baseball bat.
Jim and Selena walk: fast, alert. But something is not be said between them... until Jim breaks the silence.
How did you know?
Selena says nothing. Continues walking.
How did you know he was infected? 22.
The blood.
The blood was everywhere. On me, on you, and...
I didn't know he was infected. Okay? I didn't know. He knew. I could see it in his face.

You need to understand, if someone gets infected, you've got somewhere between ten and twenty seconds to kill them. They might be your brother or your sister or your oldest friend. It makes no difference Just so as you know, if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.
A moment.
How long had you known him?
Five days. Or six. Does it matter?
Jim says nothing.
He was full of plans. Long-distance weapons, so they don't get close. A newsagent's with a metal grill, so you can sleep. Petrol bombs, so the blood doesn't splash.
Selena looks at Jim dispassionately.
Got a plan yet, Jim? You want us to find a cure and save the world? Or fall in love and fuck?
Selena looks away again.
Plans are pointless. Staying alive is as good as it gets.
Silence. 23.
They walk. Jim following a few steps behind Selena.
A few moments later, Jim lifts a hand, opens his mouth, a to say something - but Selena cuts him off without even looking round.
Shhh.
She has seen something...
A line of tower blocks some distance away, standing again the night sky. In one of them, hanging in the window of o of the highest stories, colored fairy lights are lit up, blinking gently.
Jim and Selena walk through the smashed glass doors of th tower block. It is extremely dark inside.

Selena switches on a flashlight and illuminates the entra hall. It is a mess. The floor is covered in broken glass dried blood. The lift doors are jammed open, and inside i dense bundle of rags - perhaps an old corpse, but impossi to tell, because the interior of the lift has been torche It is black with carbon, and smoke-scarring runs up the outside wall.
Selena moves the flashlight to the stairwell. There is a tangle of shopping trolleys running up the stairs.

Selena gives one of the trolleys an exploratory tug. It shifts, but holds fast, meshed in with its neighbor. Then puts a foot into one of the grates, and lifts herself up. Shining her light over the top of the tangle, she can see gap along the top.
Let's hope we don't have to get out of here in a hurry.
She begins to climb through.

Jim and Selena move steadily and quietly up the stairwell into the building. Reaching a next landing, they check ar the corner before proceeding. Through a broken window, we see that they are already high above most London building and on the wall a sign reads: LEVEL 5. 24.
Need a break?
(completely out of breath) No. You?
No.
They continue a few steps.
I do need a break, by the way.
Selena nods. They stop on the stairs. Jim slips off his backpack and sits, pulling a face as he does so...
What's up?
Nothing.
She gives him a cut-the-crap expression.
I've got a headache.
Bad?
Pretty bad.
Why didn't you say something before?
Because I didn't think you'd give a shit.
A moment, where it's unclear how Selena will react to thi Then she slips off her own backpack.
(going through the bag) You've got no fat on you, and all you've had to eat is sugar. So you're crashing. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot we can do about that... 25.
Selena starts to produce a wide selection of pills, loote from a chemist.
...except pump you full painkillers, and give you more sugar to eat.
She holds up a bottle of codeine tablets, and passes it t Jim.
As for the sugar: Lilt or Tango?
...Do you have Sprite?
Actually, I did have a can of Sprite, but...
Suddenly there is a loud scream, coming from somewhere lo down the building. Jim and Selena both make a grab for th weapons.
Jesus!
Quiet.
The scream comes again. The noise is chilling, echoing up empty stairwell.
But there is something strange about it. The noise is hum but oddly autistic. It is held for slightly too long, and stops abruptly.
That's an infected.
Then, the sound of metal scraping, clattering the blockad
They're in.
Two Infected, a Young Asian Guy and a Young White Guy, mo with amazing speed over the blockade. 26.
Jim and Selena sprint up the stairs. Behind them, we can the Infected, giving chase, howling.
They pass level eight, nine, ten...
Jim is exhausted.
Come on!
(out of breath, barely able to speak) I can't.
Selena continues, and Jim looks over the edge of the stairwell, to the landing below...
...where the two Infected appear, tearing around the corn
Selena sprints up the stairs... and Jim sprints past her, an amazing burst of energy and speed.
They round another bend in the stairwell...
...then both Jim and Selena scream. Standing directly in front of them is a Man In Riot Cop Gear - helmet with ful visor, gloves, a riot shield in one hand, and a length of lead pipe in the other.
The Man lunges past both of them, barging past, where the Infected White Man has appeared at the stairwell.
The Riot Gear Man swings his lead pipe and connects vicio with the White Man's head. The White Man falls backwards against the Asian Man. Both fall back down the stairs.
The Riot Gear Man turns back to Jim and Selena.
Down the corridor! Flat 157!
Jim and Selena are stunned, but start to run down the corridor.
The Asian Man is coming back up the stairs. Jim looks bac over his shoulder in time to see the Riot Gear Man delive massive blow to the Asian Man's head. 27.
Jim and Selena run towards Flat 157. The door is open, bu they approach, it suddenly slams shut.
(hammering on the door) Let us in!
Who is it?
Let us in!
The door opens a fraction, on the chain. The face of a gi appears. She is fourteen, pale, solemn-faced.
Where's Dad?
Jim looks back down the corridor.
At the far end, the Man appears. He is holding the limp b of one of the Infected - and he tips it over the balcony, where it drops down the middle of the stairwell.
It's okay, Hannah. Let them inside.
The door closes, we hear the chain being slipped off, the opens again.
Jim and Selena enter past the pale-faced girl. The flat i council, three-bed, sixteenth floor of the block. It has patterned wallpaper, and nice but boring furnishings. It lit by candles.
The entrance hall leads straight to the living room, whic has French windows and a small balcony outside.

On one wall, a framed photograph hangs, which shows the M standing beside a black taxi cab. Next to him is a middle aged woman - presumably the Man's wife. Hannah sits at th cab's steering wheel, beaming.
Another photo, beside, show Hannah sat in the seat of a g kart.
The Man follows Jim and Selena inside. 28.
Come in, come in.
They follow the Man through to the living room, and Hanna recloses the front door, which has an impressive arrangem of locks and dead-bolts.
In the living room, the fairy lights hang in the window, powered by a car battery. Lit by their glow, the Man goes through a careful ritual of shedding his gear, helped by Hannah.

First, he lays down the riot shield. Then he puts the bloodsmeared lead pipe on a small white towel. Next, he removes his gloves - and places them beside the bar on th towel. Then he folds the towel over the weapon and gloves and puts it beside the riot shield. Finally he removes th visored helmet.
Jim and Selena watch him. They look pretty rattled, not really knowing what to expect.
After the Man has finished shedding his gear, he turns.
So... I'm Frank, anyway.
He extends his hand to Jim and Selena. Jim hesitates very briefly, then shakes it.
I'm Jim.
Selena.
Frank beams, and suddenly he seems much less frightening imposing. If anything, he is just as nervous as Jim and Selena.
